subject: American spelling for -ire terminals?
msgSnippet: For words like desire, mire, fire & tire, I would like to know if there is a difference between the British & American pronunciation of those words. In
messageBody:
For words like "desire," "mire," "fire" & "tire," I would like to know
if there is a difference between the British & American pronunciation
of those words. In the Quikscript manual on page 13, it is indicated
that the "ire" in "mire" should be spelt #31+#25. Does this spelling
presume the presense of a slight "-er" sound in each of the above
examples or does the British pronunciation differ such that there is
no "-er" sound in the above words (such as the "pir-" in the word
"pirate" has very little "-er" sound when compared to the first four
examples)?

Thank you.

For words like "desire," "mire," "fire" & "tire," I would like to know
if there is a difference between the British & American pronunciation
of those words. In the Quikscript manual on page 13, it is indicated
that the "ire" in "mire" should be spelt #31+#25. Does this spelling
presume the presense of a slight "-er" sound in each of the above
examples or does the British pronunciation differ such that there is
no "-er" sound in the above words (such as the "pir-" in the word
"pirate" has very little "-er" sound when compared to the first four
examples)?

Thank you.
